theme: Bar staff upsell + local promos on slow nights

avatar_style.persona: A friendly, observant female bar staff member in her late 20s, with a knack for smart solutions.
avatar_style.wardrobe: Casual, stylish bar uniform (e.g., black t-shirt or polo, dark jeans/pants, apron).
avatar_style.setting: A dimly lit, cozy bar during a slow evening, with a few empty tables and a prominent TV screen behind the bar or in a lounge area.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Ever have those slow nights at the bar? Empty seats, low tips…
script.broll_cue: Host looking around a quiet bar, a bit deflated.

script.speaker: host
script.line: But what if those quiet TVs could actually help?
script.broll_cue: Host gestures towards a blank TV screen in the bar.

script.speaker: host
script.line: That's where Trillboards comes in. It's software that turns any TV into a smart screen for your specials.
script.broll_cue: Host quickly pulls out her phone, starts tapping the Trillboards app icon.

script.speaker: host
script.line: No hardware, just your phone and a quick QR scan.
script.broll_cue: Host scans a QR code on a 'screen.trillboards.com' page displayed on the TV.

script.speaker: host
script.line: We use it to highlight our happy hour, tonight's cocktail, or even that new appetizer.
script.broll_cue: TV screen now shows rotating cards: 'Happy Hour!', 'Tonight's Special Cocktail!', 'New Appetizer Alert!'. Host gestures proudly at the screen.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It's always rotating, so customers see what's new without us pushing it.
script.broll_cue: Close-up on the TV, showing smooth transitions between cards.

script.speaker: host
script.line: And the cool part? You can add local promos. Think barber shops, yoga studios, local events.
script.broll_cue: Host on phone, scrolling through local promo options in the Trillboards app. TV briefly shows a local yoga studio promo.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It's extra income for the bar. We're talking like $10-$40 a day, depending on traffic.
script.broll_cue: Host winks, showing a small stack of bills (prop money) discreetly. TV displays a 'Local Business Offer' card.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It's super low-maintenance. We set it, forget it, and update on the fly.
script.broll_cue: Host casually wipes the bar counter, glances at the TV, then back to work, emphasizing ease of use.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Make your quiet nights work harder. Just ask your manager for permission first!
script.broll_cue: Host smiles confidently, looking at the camera, then gestures towards the now active TV screen. Final shot of the TV displaying a mix of house and local promos.
script.on_screen_text: Boost Your Bar's Bottom Line (with permission!)

caption_overlay.text: Trillboards: TV for Local Promos & Specials
Low effort, high impact. Ask your manager!

primary: Bar TV screen displaying Trillboards content (bar specials, local promos)
secondary: Subtle money imagery (small stack of bills)
Happy customers occasionally glancing at TV

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Highlighting a quiet bar and underutilized TV
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Sets up Trillboards as the solution to a common bar challenge (slow nights, missed upsell opportunities).
Demonstrates the simplicity and hardware-free nature of setup.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Choosing playlist template (bar specials) and adding house items
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Shows how Trillboards directly addresses upsell and communication for the bar's own offerings.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Adding paid local promos from the marketplace
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Illustrates the revenue-generating aspect and how it creates additional value for the venue.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Swapping cards on the fly from the app
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Emphasizes the ease of ongoing use and flexibility without babysitting.

constraints_and_risks: Venue permission is crucial for any TV use or third-party promotions.
Ensure local promos do not compete directly with the host venue's primary business (e.g., no competing bar promos).
Earnings are variable and dependent on venue foot traffic, hours, and demand from local advertisers. Avoid over-promising.

metrics_hypothesis.shareability_notes: Targets bar staff, small business owners, and hospitality managers looking for side-hustle or efficiency hacks. Shareable among industry groups.

alt_hooks: Tired of just wiping down counters on slow nights? Your TV could be earning!
What if your bar's quietest asset became its biggest earner?

rights_and_clearance_notes: Requires clearance for any stock footage used (bar environment, generic customer interactions). Music should be royalty-free. No specific brand logos other than Trillboards.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Wide shot of a cozy, dimly lit bar on a quiet evening. A female bar staff member in her late 20s, wearing a simple black t-shirt and apron, stands behind the bar, looking a bit bored and tired. There are only a few empty tables visible. A prominent, blank TV screen is on the wall behind the bar.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Sets visual style and character appearance for entire video. Establishes the 'slow night' problem.
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Slow zoom in on the host's face as she looks around.
scene_breakdown.lighting_notes: Soft, warm, ambient lighting, typical of a bar at night.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. The bar staff member pulls out her smartphone, eyes the blank TV screen thoughtfully, then quickly taps the Trillboards app icon on her phone. She then points her phone at the TV, displaying a QR code on the TV's screen (simulated 'screen.trillboards.com' webpage).
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain same character, lighting, and setting. Transition from contemplation to action.
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Medium shot, following the host's actions, with clear view of phone and TV interaction.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. The TV screen now bursts to life, displaying vibrant, rotating digital cards showing 'Happy Hour!' drinks, 'Tonight's Special Cocktail!', and a 'New Appetizer Alert!'. The bar staff member smiles, gestures proudly at the TV, then quickly taps something on her phone, showing the ease of managing cards.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain consistent character, setting, and lighting. Focus on the positive transformation of the TV.
key_visual_elements: Host interacting with Trillboards app on phone
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Alternating close-ups between the TV screen and the host's phone/face.
scene_breakdown.lighting_notes: Same lighting, but the TV screen provides dynamic light.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. The TV screen now seamlessly transitions to a 'Local Yoga Studio Offer' card, then a 'Local Barber Shop Discount'. The bar staff member discreetly shows a small stack of prop bills in her hand, winking at the camera, emphasizing the earnings. Her phone shows the 'Local Promos Marketplace' in the Trillboards app.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain character, setting, and lighting. Show the financial benefit.
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Medium shot, clearly showing the TV content and the host's subtle money gesture.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. The bar staff member casually wipes the counter, glancing at the TV, which is still rotating a mix of house specials and local promos. A customer briefly walks by, glancing at the TV with interest. The host then looks directly at the camera with a confident, encouraging smile, gesturing towards the TV.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain character, setting, and lighting. Conclude with ease of use and call to action.
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Medium shot to wider shot to show bar activity and TV, then a final confident close-up on the host.
